Over the weekend I told the subs community this feels like a real ‚ÄúChatGPT moment‚Äù for AI agents driven by the breakout of Claude CoWork + Clawdbot. 

Two of my favorite names for Agentic AI are both up ~10% today:
‚Ä¢ $NET monetizes the control layer agents must pass through to access data, APIs & users in real time
‚Ä¢ $DOCN monetizes the long-tail of agent workloads that need persistent compute but don‚Äôt want $AMZN AWS, $MSFT Azure or $GOOGL Cloud pricing/complexity
People finally starting to realize that $NET may be the biggest winner of the Claude CoWork + Clawdbot ‚ÄúChatGPT moment.‚Äù

The update would integrate Gemini directly into Siri‚Äôs responses

Very excited to start the week off announcing a new strategic partnership between Futurum and EightCo Holdings (Nasdaq: $ORBS) to bring a new critical vector to technology evaluation. AI Trust and Transparency. 

Al is advancing at an unprecedented pace, and enterprises increasingly require reliable, objective insight into which Al solutions deliver measurable performance, built on secure, authenticated, and transparent foundations. FOTAP is purpose-built to help enterprises deploy trusted Al solutions with confidence, backed by rigorous standards and governance.

Together Futurum and EightCo will be delivering the standard for trusted AI in the enterprise and Futurum will build this as core technology in its AI Platform and Autonomous Evaluation Platfrom, Futurum Signal.

$IONQ just became a U.S. foundry for under $2B  ü§Ø

$IONQ is buying chip maker $SKYT for ~$1.8B or $35 per share.

The deal secures U.S.-based fabrication giving IonQ more control over how fast it scales & how reliably it can deliver systems.

I love this because a domestic foundry matters A TON for federal & defense contracts.

In today's  Early Look: "Heavy #Quad1 Metal!"

I spend less time wondering WHY consensus Old Wall money managers miss these major Global Macro moves. The answer is simple: They don't have a process to do what we do

If they did, they‚Äôd be Long of our Q1 Macro Theme ‚ÄúLong Gold, Metals, and EM‚Äù

"When you really believe that trading is simply a probability game, concepts like 'right' and 'wrong' or 'win' and 'lose' no longer have the same significance." - Mark Douglas

Right, wrong, win, lose are words that anchor your ego on the outcome. Play the odds. Sometimes there is value in pressing, sometimes in folding. Focus on process and play the long game.
We're not long Tin, but we are long of Palladium in $PALL terms

üì∫ WHY EXTENDED METALS ARE NO LONGER BUYS

I am not currently positioned in $SLV or $GLD. I tried to avoid fighting trends or chasing extended moves and prefer opportunistic, risk-defined setups rather than emotional ‚Äúpain trades.‚Äù

At this stage, it‚Äôs too late to buy silver or gold ‚Äî trimming or trailing makes more sense. I would even consider buying short-dated $SLV puts post-Fed as a hedge.

üì∫ $AAPL & $TSLA ARE MY PLAYS INTO EARNINGS

The market remains range-bound heading into a busy week with major earnings and the Fed meeting on Wednesday, with the $SPY and $QQQ holding key support levels and showing no major technical damage.

Some mega-cap tech names are stabilizing, with $AAPL standing out as a potential pre-earnings value setup after a sharp pullback, low RSI, and room for a relief rally if results are better than feared.

$TSLA is consolidating after a strong prior move. I am watching key support and considering small options positions into earnings. The current dip could be a potential pivot ahead of the conference call narrative.

Come to trade $AAPL & $TSLA with me this week: t3live.com/trade-with-scott

Quick WSJ
GOLD BREAKS ABOVE $5,000 FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER

2022 was the year when risk-off Treasuries failed to counter risk-on stocks as a hedge against volatility.

2026 could be the flight-to-safety trade back into Treasuries finally returns.

If I‚Äôm right, the ATAC Credit Rotation ETF $JOJO can potentially benefit.

üßµüëá (1/10)
I love the chaos you bring to your tweets, it's really fun üòÅü§£

At some point if Japan sparks a global credit event, credit spreads likely blow out and junk debt becomes painful.

That is what $JOJO is built for ‚Äì to tactically avoid those credit events, and hide in long duration Treasuries as those events are occurring. (7/10)

Learn more about $JOJO at atacfunds.com/jojo/

Lead-Lag Publishing, LLC is not an affiliate of Tidal/Toroso or ACA/Foreside.

One final note.

I plan on doing more threads to address $ATACX in the weeks ahead.

Each Fund has different signals to rotate risk-on, or risk-off.

But they all rely on Treasuries as the risk-off trade.
This is not about signals.

This is about cycles.
(10/10)

Now there is yield for bond funds, like $JOJO.

Now there are tactical opportunities for bond funds, like $JOJO.

Keep an open mind.

One year does not invalidate decades of research.

Consider $JOJO as part of your bond allocation. (9/10)

$JOJO may be able to take advantage of the high yields and return potential of junk bonds when skies are clear, but quickly pivot to the ‚Äúflight to safety trade‚Äù of Treasuries.

That flight to safety trade failed in 2022, hurting all ATAC Funds.

I believe it comes back now. (8/10)

Since the 1920s, the 10-year Treasury bond has declined by more than 10% once - an 11% loss in 2009 during the financial crisis.

In 2022 it lost 18% making it only the 2nd time this ever happened.

We believe there is now an opportunity in Treasuries, in risk-off. (5/10)

In periods of heightened volatility for the stock market, two things typically happen on average.

1) Credit spreads widen as bond investors perceive volatility in stocks as increasing default risk.

2) Treasuries become the "flight-to-safety" trade during stress.

(4/10)

$JOJO uses the relative performance of Utilities against US Large-Cap Stocks to determine when to be junk-on in high yield bond ETFs, or junk-off in long-duration Treasuries.

Why?

As shown in the 2014 Dow Award paper, Utilities historically signal higher volatility. (4/10)

I have seen some argue that I am ducking criticisms around my Funds.

These comments do not understand how my industry works.

This thread is meant to set the record straight on the conditions $JOJO is designed for. (3/10)

First, allow me to clarify that all of my rules-based Funds are separate from my research (The Lead-Lag Report).

Rules-based means the Funds are not based on my discretionary thinking.

Tweets around my Funds ( $JOJO, $ATACX ) require compliance review and approval. (2/10)

Japan will panic.

And so will the Fed.

I was right.

I was fucking right.

Tell me again that Japan doesn‚Äôt fucking matter for US stocks.

FUCKING TELL ME AGAIN.
The biggest moves up (and down) in my portfolio have been the result of being very right (or wrong) at that moment.
Governments buying governments money to protect traders is peak wall st.
